intro: Hibbertia billardierei var. scabra, commonly known as the rough hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine, rough hairs, contributing to its common name. Hibbertia billardierei var. scabra is a perennial shrub that thrives in well-drained conditions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
